an7.1:1.2.pli: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
an7.1:1.2.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.

an7.1:1.3.eng: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants,

an7.1:2.1.pli: “Sattahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu sabrahmacārīnaṃ appiyo ca hoti amanāpo ca agaru ca abhāvanīyo ca.
an7.1:2.1.eng: “Mendicants, a mendicant with seven qualities is disliked and disapproved by their spiritual companions, not respected or admired.

an7.1:2.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu lābhakāmo ca hoti, sakkārakāmo ca hoti, anavaññattikāmo ca hoti, ahiriko ca hoti, anottappī ca, pāpiccho ca, micchādiṭṭhi ca.
an7.1:2.3.eng: It’s when a mendicant desires material things, honor, and status. They lack conscience and prudence. They have corrupt wishes and wrong view.

an7.1:2.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, sattahi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu sabrahmacārīnaṃ appiyo ca hoti amanāpo ca agaru ca abhāvanīyo ca.
an7.1:2.4.eng: A mendicant with these seven qualities is disliked and disapproved by their spiritual companions, not respected or admired.

an7.1:3.1.pli: Sattahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu sabrahmacārīnaṃ piyo ca hoti, manāpo ca garu ca bhāvanīyo ca.
an7.1:3.1.eng: A mendicant with seven qualities is liked and approved by their spiritual companions, respected and admired.

an7.1:3.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu na lābhakāmo ca hoti, na sakkārakāmo ca hoti, na anavaññattikāmo ca hoti, hirīmā ca hoti, ottappī ca, appiccho ca, sammādiṭṭhi ca.
an7.1:3.3.eng: It’s when a mendicant doesn’t desire material things, honor, and status. They have conscience and prudence. They have few desires and right view.

an7.1:3.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, sattahi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu sabrahmacārīnaṃ piyo ca hoti manāpo ca garu ca bhāvanīyo cā”ti.
an7.1:3.4.eng: A mendicant with these seven qualities is liked and approved by their spiritual companions, respected and admired.”

an7.10:1.3.pli: Anunayasaṃyojanaṃ, paṭighasaṃyojanaṃ, diṭṭhisaṃyojanaṃ, vicikicchāsaṃyojanaṃ, mānasaṃyojanaṃ, issāsaṃyojanaṃ, macchariyasaṃyojanaṃ.
an7.10:1.3.eng: The fetters of attraction, repulsion, views, doubt, conceit, jealousy, and stinginess.

an7.11:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, there are these seven underlying tendencies.

an7.11:1.3.pli: Kāmarāgānusayo, paṭighānusayo, diṭṭhānusayo, vicikicchānusayo, mānānusayo, bhavarāgānusayo, avijjānusayo.
an7.11:1.3.eng: The underlying tendencies of sensual desire, repulsion, views, doubt, conceit, desire for continued existence, and ignorance.

an7.11:1.4.eng: These are the seven underlying tendencies.”

an7.12:1.1.pli: “Sattannaṃ, bhikkhave, anusayānaṃ pahānāya samucchedāya brahmacariyaṃ vussati.
an7.12:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, the spiritual life is lived to give up and cut out these seven underlying tendencies.

an7.12:1.3.pli: Kāmarāgānusayassa pahānāya samucchedāya brahmacariyaṃ vussati, paṭighānusayassa …pe…
an7.12:1.3.eng: The underlying tendencies of sensual desire, repulsion, views, doubt, conceit, desire to be reborn, and ignorance.

an7.12:1.9.pli: Imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, sattannaṃ anusayānaṃ pahānāya samucchedāya brahmacariyaṃ vussati.
an7.12:1.9.eng: The spiritual life is lived to give up and cut out these seven underlying tendencies.

an7.12:2.1.pli: Yato ca kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno kāmarāgānusayo pahīno hoti ucchinnamūlo tālāvatthukato anabhāvaṅkato āyatiṃ anuppādadhammo.
an7.12:2.1.eng: When a mendicant has given up the underlying tendencies of sensual desire, repulsion, views, doubt, conceit, desire to be reborn, and ignorance—cut them off at the root, made them like a palm stump, obliterated them, so they are unable to arise in the future—

an7.12:2.7.pli: avijjānusayo pahīno hoti ucchinnamūlo tālāvatthukato anabhāvaṅkato āyatiṃ anuppādadhammo.

an7.12:2.8.pli: Ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, bhikkhu acchecchi taṇhaṃ, vivattayi saṃyojanaṃ, sammā mānābhisamayā antamakāsi dukkhassā”ti.
an7.12:2.8.eng: they’re called a mendicant who has cut off craving, cast off the fetters, and by rightly comprehending conceit has made an end of suffering.”

an7.13:1.1.pli: “Sattahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgataṃ kulaṃ anupagantvā vā nālaṃ upagantuṃ, upagantvā vā nālaṃ upanisīdituṃ.
an7.13:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, visiting a family with seven factors is not worthwhile, or if you’ve already arrived, sitting down is not worthwhile.

an7.13:1.3.pli: Na manāpena paccuṭṭhenti, na manāpena abhivādenti, na manāpena āsanaṃ denti, santamassa pariguhanti, bahukampi thokaṃ denti, paṇītampi lūkhaṃ denti, asakkaccaṃ denti no sakkaccaṃ.
an7.13:1.3.eng: They don’t politely rise, bow, or offer a seat. They hide what they have. Even when they have much they give little. Even when they have fine things they give coarse things. They give carelessly, not carefully.

an7.13:1.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, sattahi aṅgehi samannāgataṃ kulaṃ anupagantvā vā nālaṃ upagantuṃ, upagantvā vā nālaṃ upanisīdituṃ.
an7.13:1.4.eng: Visiting a family with these seven factors is not worthwhile, or if you’ve already arrived, sitting down is not worthwhile.

an7.13:2.1.pli: Sattahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgataṃ kulaṃ anupagantvā vā alaṃ upagantuṃ, upagantvā vā alaṃ upanisīdituṃ.
an7.13:2.1.eng: Visiting a family with seven factors is worthwhile, or if you’ve already arrived, sitting down is worthwhile.

an7.13:2.3.pli: Manāpena paccuṭṭhenti, manāpena abhivādenti, manāpena āsanaṃ denti, santamassa na pariguhanti, bahukampi bahukaṃ denti, paṇītampi paṇītaṃ denti, sakkaccaṃ denti no asakkaccaṃ.
an7.13:2.3.eng: They politely rise, bow, and offer a seat. They don’t hide what they have. When they have much they give much. When they have refined things they give refined things. They give carefully, not carelessly.

an7.13:2.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, sattahi aṅgehi samannāgataṃ kulaṃ anupagantvā vā alaṃ upagantuṃ, upagantvā vā alaṃ upanisīditun”ti.
an7.13:2.4.eng: Visiting a family with these seven factors is worthwhile, or if you’ve already arrived, sitting down is worthwhile.”

an7.14:1.1.pli: “Sattime, bhikkhave, puggalā āhuneyyā pāhuneyyā dakkhiṇeyyā añjalikaraṇīyā anuttaraṃ puññakkhettaṃ lokassa.
an7.14:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, these seven individuals are worthy of offerings dedicated to the gods, worthy of hospitality, worthy of a religious donation, worthy of greeting with joined palms, and are the supreme field of merit for the world.

an7.14:1.3.pli: Ubhatobhāgavimutto, paññāvimutto, kāyasakkhī, diṭṭhippatto, saddhāvimutto, dhammānusārī, saddhānusārī.
an7.14:1.3.eng: The one freed both ways, the one freed by wisdom, the direct witness, the one attained to view, the one freed by faith, the follower of teachings, and the follower by faith.

an7.14:1.4.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, satta puggalā āhuneyyā pāhuneyyā dakkhiṇeyyā añjalikaraṇīyā anuttaraṃ puññakkhettaṃ lokassā”ti.
an7.14:1.4.eng: These are the seven individuals who are worthy of offerings dedicated to the gods, worthy of hospitality, worthy of a religious donation, worthy of greeting with joined palms, and are the supreme field of merit for the world.”

an7.15:1.1.pli: “Sattime, bhikkhave, udakūpamā puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ.
an7.15:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, these seven individuals found in the world are like those in water.

an7.15:1.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo sakiṃ nimuggo nimuggova hoti;
an7.15:1.3.eng: One individual sinks under once and stays under.

an7.15:1.4.pli: idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo ummujjitvā nimujjati;
an7.15:1.4.eng: One individual rises up then sinks under.

an7.15:1.5.pli: idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo ummujjitvā ṭhito hoti;
an7.15:1.5.eng: One individual rises up then stays put.

an7.15:1.6.pli: idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo ummujjitvā vipassati viloketi;
an7.15:1.6.eng: One individual rises up then sees and discerns.

an7.15:1.7.pli: idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo ummujjitvā patarati;
an7.15:1.7.eng: One individual rises up then crosses over.

an7.15:1.8.pli: idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo ummujjitvā patigādhappatto hoti;
an7.15:1.8.eng: One individual rises up then finds a foothold.

an7.15:1.9.pli: idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo ummujjitvā tiṇṇo hoti pāraṅgato thale tiṭṭhati brāhmaṇo.
an7.15:1.9.eng: One individual has risen up, crossed over, and gone to the far shore, a brahmin who stands on solid ground.

an7.15:2.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo sakiṃ nimuggo nimuggova hoti?
an7.15:2.1.eng: And what kind of individual sinks under once and stays under?

an7.15:2.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo samannāgato hoti ekantakāḷakehi akusalehi dhammehi.
an7.15:2.2.eng: It’s the kind of individual who has exclusively dark, unskillful qualities.

an7.15:2.3.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo sakiṃ nimuggo nimuggova hoti.
an7.15:2.3.eng: This kind of individual sinks under once and stays under.

an7.15:3.1.eng: And what kind of individual rises up then sinks under?

an7.15:3.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo ummujjati sādhu saddhā kusalesu dhammesu, sādhu hirī …pe…
an7.15:3.2.eng: It’s the kind of individual who, rising up, thinks: ‘It’s good to have faith, conscience, prudence, energy, and wisdom regarding skillful qualities.’

an7.15:3.6.pli: Tassa sā saddhā neva tiṭṭhati no vaḍḍhati hāyatiyeva, tassa sā hirī …pe…
an7.15:3.6.eng: However their faith, conscience, prudence, energy, and wisdom don’t last or grow, but dwindle away.

an7.15:3.9.pli: tassa sā paññā neva tiṭṭhati no vaḍḍhati hāyatiyeva.

an7.15:3.10.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo ummujjitvā nimujjati.
an7.15:3.10.eng: This kind of individual rises up then sinks under.

an7.15:4.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo ummujjitvā ṭhito hoti?
an7.15:4.1.eng: And what kind of individual rises up then stays put?

an7.15:4.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo ummujjati sādhu saddhā kusalesu dhammesu, sādhu hirī …pe…
an7.15:4.2.eng: It’s the kind of individual who, rising up, thinks: ‘It’s good to have faith, conscience, prudence, energy, and wisdom regarding skillful qualities.’

an7.15:4.6.pli: Tassa sā saddhā neva hāyati no vaḍḍhati ṭhitā hoti.
an7.15:4.6.eng: And their faith, conscience, prudence, energy, and wisdom lasts, neither dwindling nor growing.

an7.15:4.10.pli: tassa sā paññā neva hāyati no vaḍḍhati ṭhitā hoti.

an7.15:4.11.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo ummujjitvā ṭhito hoti.
an7.15:4.11.eng: This kind of individual rises up then stays put.

an7.15:5.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo ummujjitvā vipassati viloketi?
an7.15:5.1.eng: And what kind of individual rises up then sees and discerns?

an7.15:5.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo ummujjati sādhu saddhā kusalesu dhammesu, sādhu hirī …pe…
an7.15:5.2.eng: It’s the kind of individual who, rising up, thinks: ‘It’s good to have faith, conscience, prudence, energy, and wisdom regarding skillful qualities.’

an7.15:5.6.pli: So tiṇṇaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā sotāpanno hoti avinipātadhammo niyato sambodhiparāyaṇo.
an7.15:5.6.eng: With the ending of three fetters they’re a stream-enterer, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, destined for awakening.

an7.15:5.7.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo ummujjitvā vipassati viloketi.
an7.15:5.7.eng: This kind of individual rises up then sees and discerns.

an7.15:6.1.eng: And what kind of individual rises up then crosses over?

an7.15:6.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo ummujjati sādhu saddhā kusalesu dhammesu, sādhu hirī …pe…
an7.15:6.2.eng: It’s the kind of individual who, rising up, thinks: ‘It’s good to have faith, conscience, prudence, energy, and wisdom regarding skillful qualities.’

an7.15:6.6.pli: So tiṇṇaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā rāgadosamohānaṃ tanuttā sakadāgāmī hoti, sakideva imaṃ lokaṃ āgantvā dukkhassantaṃ karoti.
an7.15:6.6.eng: With the ending of three fetters, and the weakening of greed, hate, and delusion, they’re a once-returner. They come back to this world once only, then make an end of suffering.

an7.15:6.7.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo ummujjitvā patarati.
an7.15:6.7.eng: This kind of individual rises up then crosses over.

an7.15:7.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo ummujjitvā patigādhappatto hoti?
an7.15:7.1.eng: And what kind of individual rises up then finds a foothold?

an7.15:7.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo ummujjati sādhu saddhā kusalesu dhammesu, sādhu hirī …pe…
an7.15:7.2.eng: It’s the kind of individual who, rising up, thinks: ‘It’s good to have faith, conscience, prudence, energy, and wisdom regarding skillful qualities.’

an7.15:7.6.pli: So pañcannaṃ orambhāgiyānaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā opapātiko hoti tattha parinibbāyī anāvattidhammo tasmā lokā.
an7.15:7.6.eng: With the ending of the five lower fetters they’re reborn spontaneously. They are extinguished there, and are not liable to return from that world.

an7.15:7.7.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo ummujjitvā patigādhappatto hoti.
an7.15:7.7.eng: This kind of individual rises up then finds a foothold.

an7.15:8.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo ummujjitvā tiṇṇo hoti pāraṅgato thale tiṭṭhati brāhmaṇo.
an7.15:8.1.eng: And what kind of individual has risen up, crossed over, and gone to the far shore, a brahmin who stands on solid ground?

an7.15:8.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo ummujjati sādhu saddhā kusalesu dhammesu, sādhu hirī …pe…
an7.15:8.2.eng: It’s the kind of individual who, rising up, thinks: ‘It’s good to have faith, conscience, prudence, energy, and wisdom regarding skillful qualities.’

an7.15:8.6.pli: So āsavānaṃ khayā anāsavaṃ cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati.
an7.15:8.6.eng: They realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And they live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.

an7.15:8.7.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo ummujjitvā tiṇṇo hoti pāraṅgato thale tiṭṭhati brāhmaṇo.
an7.15:8.7.eng: This kind of individual has risen up, crossed over, and gone to the far shore, a brahmin who stands on solid ground.

an7.15:9.1.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, satta udakūpamā puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmin”ti.
an7.15:9.1.eng: These seven individuals found in the world are like those in water.”

an7.16:1.1.pli: “Sattime, bhikkhave, puggalā āhuneyyā pāhuneyyā dakkhiṇeyyā añjalikaraṇīyā anuttaraṃ puññakkhettaṃ lokassa.
an7.16:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, these seven individuals are worthy of offerings dedicated to the gods, worthy of hospitality, worthy of a religious donation, worthy of greeting with joined palms, and are the supreme field of merit for the world.

an7.16:1.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo sabbasaṅkhāresu aniccānupassī viharati, aniccasaññī, aniccapaṭisaṃvedī satataṃ samitaṃ abbokiṇṇaṃ cetasā adhimuccamāno paññāya pariyogāhamāno.
an7.16:1.3.eng: First, take an individual who meditates observing impermanence in all conditions. They perceive impermanence and experience impermanence. Constantly, continually, and without interruption, they apply the mind and fathom with wisdom.

an7.16:1.4.pli: So āsavānaṃ khayā …pe… sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati.
an7.16:1.4.eng: They’ve realized the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.

an7.16:1.5.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, paṭhamo puggalo āhuneyyo pāhuneyyo dakkhiṇeyyo añjalikaraṇīyo anuttaraṃ puññakkhettaṃ lokassa.

an7.16:2.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, idhekacco puggalo sabbasaṅkhāresu aniccānupassī viharati, aniccasaññī, aniccapaṭisaṃvedī satataṃ samitaṃ abbokiṇṇaṃ cetasā adhimuccamāno paññāya pariyogāhamāno.
an7.16:2.1.eng: Next, take an individual who meditates observing impermanence in all conditions.

an7.16:2.2.pli: Tassa apubbaṃ acarimaṃ āsavapariyādānañca hoti jīvitapariyādānañca.
an7.16:2.2.eng: Their defilements and their life come to an end at exactly the same time.

an7.16:2.3.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, dutiyo puggalo āhuneyyo …pe… anuttaraṃ puññakkhettaṃ lokassa.

an7.16:3.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, idhekacco puggalo sabbasaṅkhāresu aniccānupassī viharati, aniccasaññī, aniccapaṭisaṃvedī satataṃ samitaṃ abbokiṇṇaṃ cetasā adhimuccamāno paññāya pariyogāhamāno.
an7.16:3.1.eng: Next, take an individual who meditates observing impermanence in all conditions.

an7.16:3.2.pli: So pañcannaṃ orambhāgiyānaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā antarāparinibbāyī hoti …pe…
an7.16:3.2.eng: With the ending of the five lower fetters they’re extinguished between one life and the next. …

an7.16:3.3.eng: With the ending of the five lower fetters they’re extinguished upon landing. …

an7.16:3.4.eng: With the ending of the five lower fetters they’re extinguished without extra effort. …

an7.16:3.5.eng: With the ending of the five lower fetters they’re extinguished with extra effort. …

an7.16:3.6.eng: With the ending of the five lower fetters they head upstream, going to the Akaniṭṭha realm.

an7.16:3.7.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, sattamo puggalo āhuneyyo pāhuneyyo dakkhiṇeyyo añjalikaraṇīyo anuttaraṃ puññakkhettaṃ lokassa.

an7.16:3.8.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, satta puggalā āhuneyyā pāhuneyyā dakkhiṇeyyā añjalikaraṇīyā anuttaraṃ puññakkhettaṃ lokassā”ti.
an7.16:3.8.eng: These are the seven individuals who are worthy of offerings dedicated to the gods, worthy of hospitality, worthy of a religious donation, worthy of greeting with joined palms, and are the supreme field of merit for the world.”

an7.17:1.1.pli: Sattime, bhikkhave, puggalā āhuneyyā …pe… anuttaraṃ puññakkhettaṃ lokassa.
an7.17:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, these seven individuals are worthy of offerings dedicated to the gods, worthy of hospitality, worthy of a religious donation, worthy of greeting with joined palms, and are the supreme field of merit for the world.

an7.17:1.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo sabbasaṅkhāresu dukkhānupassī viharati …pe….
an7.17:1.3.eng: First, take an individual who meditates observing suffering in all conditions. They perceive suffering and experience suffering. Constantly, continually, and without interruption, they apply the mind and fathom with wisdom. …”

an7.18:1.1.eng: “First, take an individual who meditates observing not-self in all things. They perceive not-self and experience not-self. Constantly, continually, and without interruption, they apply the mind and fathom with wisdom. …”

an7.19:1.1.pli: “Nibbāne sukhānupassī viharati sukhasaññī sukhapaṭisaṃvedī satataṃ samitaṃ abbokiṇṇaṃ cetasā adhimuccamāno paññāya pariyogāhamāno.
an7.19:1.1.eng: “One meditates observing the happiness in extinguishment. They perceive happiness and experience happiness. Constantly, continually, and without interruption, they apply the mind and fathom with wisdom.

an7.19:1.2.pli: So āsavānaṃ khayā …pe… sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati.
an7.19:1.2.eng: They’ve realized the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.

an7.19:1.3.pli: Ayaṃ bhikkhave, paṭhamo puggalo āhuneyyo …pe… puññakkhettaṃ lokassa.
an7.19:1.3.eng: This is the first individual worthy of offerings.

an7.19:2.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, idhekacco puggalo nibbāne sukhānupassī viharati sukhasaññī sukhapaṭisaṃvedī satataṃ samitaṃ abbokiṇṇaṃ cetasā adhimuccamāno paññāya pariyogāhamāno.
an7.19:2.1.eng: Next, take an individual who meditates observing the happiness in extinguishment. They perceive happiness and experience happiness. Constantly, continually, and without interruption, they apply the mind and fathom with wisdom.

an7.19:2.2.pli: Tassa apubbaṃ acarimaṃ āsavapariyādānañca hoti jīvitapariyādānañca.
an7.19:2.2.eng: Their defilements and their life come to an end at exactly the same time.

an7.19:2.3.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, dutiyo puggalo āhuneyyo …pe… anuttaraṃ puññakkhettaṃ lokassa.

an7.19:3.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, idhekacco puggalo nibbāne sukhānupassī viharati sukhasaññī sukhapaṭisaṃvedī satataṃ samitaṃ abbokiṇṇaṃ cetasā adhimuccamāno paññāya pariyogāhamāno.
an7.19:3.1.eng: Next, take an individual who meditates observing the happiness in extinguishment. They perceive happiness and experience happiness. Constantly, continually, and without interruption, they apply the mind and fathom with wisdom.

an7.19:3.2.pli: So pañcannaṃ orambhāgiyānaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā antarāparinibbāyī hoti …pe…
an7.19:3.2.eng: With the ending of the five lower fetters they’re extinguished between one life and the next. …

an7.19:3.3.eng: With the ending of the five lower fetters they’re extinguished upon landing. …

an7.19:3.4.eng: With the ending of the five lower fetters they’re extinguished without extra effort. …

an7.19:3.5.eng: With the ending of the five lower fetters they’re extinguished with extra effort. …

an7.19:3.6.eng: With the ending of the five lower fetters they head upstream, going to the Akaniṭṭha realm.

an7.19:3.7.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, sattamo puggalo āhuneyyo …pe… anuttaraṃ puññakkhettaṃ lokassa.

an7.19:3.8.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, satta puggalā āhuneyyā …pe… anuttaraṃ puññakkhettaṃ lokassā”ti.
an7.19:3.8.eng: These are the seven individuals who are worthy of offerings dedicated to the gods, worthy of hospitality, worthy of a religious donation, worthy of greeting with joined palms, and are the supreme field of merit for the world.”

an7.2:1.1.pli: “Sattahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu sabrahmacārīnaṃ appiyo ca hoti amanāpo ca agaru ca abhāvanīyo ca.
an7.2:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, a mendicant with seven qualities is disliked and disapproved by their spiritual companions, not respected or admired.

an7.2:1.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu lābhakāmo ca hoti, sakkārakāmo ca hoti, anavaññattikāmo ca hoti, ahiriko ca hoti, anottappī ca, issukī ca, maccharī ca.
an7.2:1.3.eng: It’s when a mendicant desires material things, honor, and status. They lack conscience and prudence. They’re jealous and stingy.

an7.2:1.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, sattahi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu sabrahmacārīnaṃ appiyo ca hoti amanāpo ca agaru ca abhāvanīyo ca.
an7.2:1.4.eng: A mendicant with these seven qualities is disliked and disapproved by their spiritual companions, not respected or admired.

an7.2:2.1.pli: Sattahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu sabrahmacārīnaṃ piyo ca hoti manāpo ca garu ca bhāvanīyo ca.
an7.2:2.1.eng: A mendicant with seven qualities is liked and approved by their spiritual companions, respected and admired.

an7.2:2.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu na lābhakāmo ca hoti, na sakkārakāmo ca hoti, na anavaññattikāmo ca hoti, hirīmā ca hoti, ottappī ca, anissukī ca, amaccharī ca.
an7.2:2.3.eng: It’s when a mendicant doesn’t desire material things, honor, and status. They have conscience and prudence. They’re not jealous or stingy.

an7.2:2.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, sattahi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu sabrahmacārīnaṃ piyo ca hoti manāpo ca garu ca bhāvanīyo cā”ti.
an7.2:2.4.eng: A mendicant with these seven qualities is liked and approved by their spiritual companions, respected and admired.”

an7.20:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, there are these seven qualifications for graduation.

an7.20:1.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sikkhāsamādāne tibbacchando hoti āyatiñca sikkhāsamādāne avigatapemo,
an7.20:1.3.eng: It’s when a mendicant has a keen enthusiasm to undertake the training …

an7.20:1.4.pli: dhammanisantiyā tibbacchando hoti āyatiñca dhammanisantiyā avigatapemo,

an7.20:1.5.pli: icchāvinaye tibbacchando hoti āyatiñca icchāvinaye avigatapemo,

an7.20:1.6.pli: paṭisallāne tibbacchando hoti āyatiñca paṭisallāne avigatapemo,

an7.20:1.7.pli: vīriyārambhe tibbacchando hoti āyatiñca vīriyārambhe avigatapemo,

an7.20:1.8.pli: satinepakke tibbacchando hoti āyatiñca satinepakke avigatapemo,

an7.20:1.9.pli: diṭṭhipaṭivedhe tibbacchando hoti āyatiñca diṭṭhipaṭivedhe avigatapemo.
an7.20:1.9.eng: to penetrate theoretically. And they don’t lose these desires in the future.

an7.20:1.10.eng: These are the seven qualifications for graduation.”

an7.21:1.2.pli: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā vesāliyaṃ viharati sārandade cetiye.
an7.21:1.2.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying near Vesālī, at the Sārandada Shrine.

an7.21:1.3.pli: Atha kho sambahulā licchavī yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdiṃsu. Ekamantaṃ nisinne kho te licchavī bhagavā etadavoca:
an7.21:1.3.eng: Then several Licchavis went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and the Buddha said to these Licchavis:

an7.21:1.4.eng: “Licchavis, I will teach you these seven principles that prevent decline.

an7.21:1.5.pli: Taṃ suṇātha, sādhukaṃ manasi karotha, bhāsissāmī”ti.
an7.21:1.5.eng: Listen and apply your mind well, I will speak.”

an7.21:1.6.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho te licchavī bhagavato paccassosuṃ.

an7.21:2.1.eng: “And what are the seven principles that prevent decline?

an7.21:2.2.pli: Yāvakīvañca, licchavī, vajjī abhiṇhaṃ sannipātā bhavissanti sannipātabahulā;
an7.21:2.2.eng: As long as the Vajjis meet frequently and have many meetings,

an7.21:2.3.pli: vuddhiyeva, licchavī, vajjīnaṃ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
an7.21:2.3.eng: they can expect growth, not decline.

an7.21:3.1.pli: Yāvakīvañca, licchavī, vajjī samaggā sannipatissanti, samaggā vuṭṭhahissanti, samaggā vajjikaraṇīyāni karissanti;
an7.21:3.1.eng: As long as the Vajjis meet in harmony, leave in harmony, and carry on their business in harmony,

an7.21:3.2.pli: vuddhiyeva, licchavī, vajjīnaṃ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
an7.21:3.2.eng: they can expect growth, not decline.

an7.21:4.1.pli: Yāvakīvañca, licchavī, vajjī apaññattaṃ na paññāpessanti, paññattaṃ na samucchindissanti, yathāpaññatte porāṇe vajjidhamme samādāya vattissanti;
an7.21:4.1.eng: As long as the Vajjis don’t make new decrees or abolish existing decrees, but undertake and follow the ancient Vajjian traditions as they have been decreed,

an7.21:4.2.pli: vuddhiyeva, licchavī, vajjīnaṃ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
an7.21:4.2.eng: they can expect growth, not decline.

an7.21:5.1.pli: Yāvakīvañca, licchavī, vajjī ye te vajjīnaṃ vajjimahallakā te sakkarissanti garuṃ karissanti mānessanti pūjessanti, tesañca sotabbaṃ maññissanti;
an7.21:5.1.eng: As long as the Vajjis honor, respect, esteem, and venerate Vajjian elders, and think them worth listening to,

an7.21:5.2.pli: vuddhiyeva, licchavī, vajjīnaṃ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
an7.21:5.2.eng: they can expect growth, not decline.

an7.21:6.1.pli: Yāvakīvañca, licchavī, vajjī yā tā kulitthiyo kulakumāriyo tā na okassa pasayha vāsessanti;
an7.21:6.1.eng: As long as the Vajjis don’t forcibly abduct the women or girls of the clans and make them live with them,

an7.21:6.2.pli: vuddhiyeva, licchavī, vajjīnaṃ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
an7.21:6.2.eng: they can expect growth, not decline.

an7.21:7.1.pli: Yāvakīvañca, licchavī, vajjī yāni tāni vajjīnaṃ vajjicetiyāni abbhantarāni ceva bāhirāni ca tāni sakkarissanti garuṃ karissanti mānessanti pūjessanti, tesañca dinnapubbaṃ katapubbaṃ dhammikaṃ baliṃ no parihāpessanti;
an7.21:7.1.eng: As long as the Vajjis honor, respect, esteem, and venerate the Vajjian shrines, whether inner or outer, not neglecting the proper spirit-offerings that were given and made in the past,

an7.21:7.2.pli: vuddhiyeva, licchavī, vajjīnaṃ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
an7.21:7.2.eng: they can expect growth, not decline.

an7.21:8.1.pli: Yāvakīvañca, licchavī, vajjīnaṃ arahantesu dhammikā rakkhāvaraṇagutti susaṃvihitā bhavissati:
an7.21:8.1.eng: As long as the Vajjis organize proper protection, shelter, and security for perfected ones, so that

an7.21:8.2.pli: ‘kinti anāgatā ca arahanto vijitaṃ āgaccheyyuṃ, āgatā ca arahanto vijite phāsuṃ vihareyyun’ti;
an7.21:8.2.eng: more perfected ones might come to the realm and those already here may live in comfort,

an7.21:8.3.pli: vuddhiyeva, licchavī, vajjīnaṃ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
an7.21:8.3.eng: they can expect growth, not decline.

an7.21:9.1.pli: Yāvakīvañca, licchavī, ime satta aparihāniyā dhammā vajjīsu ṭhassanti, imesu ca sattasu aparihāniyesu dhammesu vajjī sandississanti;
an7.21:9.1.eng: As long as these seven principles that prevent decline last among the Vajjis, and as long as the Vajjis are seen following them,

an7.21:9.2.pli: vuddhiyeva, licchavī, vajjīnaṃ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihānī”ti.
an7.21:9.2.eng: they can expect growth, not decline.”
